intro: Thlaspi pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Thlaspi pubescens is a perennial species that is adapted to cold climates and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
